title: Ticket #6798: negotiator core dump with meta if-defined operator
description:
Use of the new ?: classad operator introduced in #5782 in a startd START expression caused the negotiator to drop core with a segmentation fault. Looks like the problem is related to flattening expressions with this operator, which is something the negotiator does to optimize an ad for matchmaking.

How I can reproduce the problem:

In a personal condor setup, I configured my startd as follows: 

   USE FEATURE:PARTITIONABLESLOT
   START = $(START) && ((CurrentTime - (max(ChildEnteredCurrentState)=?=UNDEFINED ? 0 : max(ChildEnteredCurrentState))) > 60 )

The above works fine. However, the negotiator will core dump during matchamking if I replace the above conditional to do the same thing with the ?: operator like so: 

   USE FEATURE:PARTITIONABLESLOT
   START = $(START) && ((CurrentTime - (max(ChildEnteredCurrentState) ?: 0)) > 60 )

Here is the tail of the NegotiatorLog: 

10/11/18 16:53:56 ---------- Started Negotiation Cycle ----------
10/11/18 16:53:56 Phase 1:  Obtaining ads from collector ...
10/11/18 16:53:56   Getting startd private ads ...
10/11/18 16:53:56 Trying to query collector <127.0.0.1:9618>
10/11/18 16:53:56   Getting Scheduler, Submitter and Machine ads ...
10/11/18 16:53:56 Trying to query collector <127.0.0.1:9618>
10/11/18 16:53:56   Sorting 3 ads ...
10/11/18 16:53:56 Intercepting an unhandled exception.
10/11/18 16:53:56 Dropping a core file.

And resulting core.NEGOTIATOR.WIN32 file when running CondorVersion: 8.6.12 Jun 19 2018 PRE-RELEASE-UWCS on Win32:
